cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles east of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Paralleling the Florida east coast, then moving north along the Georgia coast before curving northeast toward South and North Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast (close to Charleston–Myrtle Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach, FL to Savannah River, GA
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Ponte Vedra Beach, FL to Savannah River, GA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from central Florida through Georgia to North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely, with a chance of hurricane-force gusts if the center tracks a little closer to the Georgia coast
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft inundation possible along the Georgia coast, including the Port of Brunswick area
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with locally higher totals could cause flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and isolated tornadoes
